The original post attributes the cause of feeling like an outcast and being kicked out of their family to something internal, specifically their own shortcomings in relationships. In contrast, the transferred post attributes the cause to something external, such as the complexities of interpersonal dynamics within families. By changing the attributional style from internal to external, we can transform how the author perceives the situation and themselves, potentially reducing feelings of self-blame and increasing the likelihood of seeking support or solutions.

In contrast, the transferred post attributes the same feeling to the external circumstances of being in a sea of boredom. The transferred post still conveys the same emotions and thoughts as the original post but reframes them in a way that highlights the impact of external circumstances rather than internal shortcomings. This approach can help individuals avoid feeling overwhelmed by negative self-talk and instead focus on finding solutions to their problems by acknowledging the role of external factors.
